text: Germany's Imperial Patent Office granted Rudolph Diesel Patent No. 67207 for "a new efficient thermal engine". We just call it, the Diesel engine.
President Calvin Coolidge signed Public Law no. 632 establishing the Federal Radio Commission which was later replaced by the Federal Communications Commission.

German physicist Werner Heisenberg wrote a letter to Wolfgang Pauli, describing the uncertainty principle for the first time. He submitted a paper on the principle for publication the following March.
